{"step_by_step_thinking": "Functional Neurological Disorder (FND) is a condition where patients experience physical neurological symptoms, but with no structural disease pathology to explain the symptoms. It is a problem with the functioning of the nervous system and how the brain and body send and receive signals. Psychosomatic disorders are conditions in which a person's physical symptoms are thought to be directly related to psychological factors. In this sense, FND could be considered a type of psychosomatic disorder as the physical symptoms are believed to be related to psychological factors.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
